p: Unlike other autonomic effectors, the PNS is active in situations that are not distressing and tend to build up rather than use up energy [ 70]. When the central stress system is activated, PNS outflows generally decrease (red negative sign in Fig. 3). Manifestations of PNS inhibition include tachycardia, decreased gastrointestinal motility, decreased production of saliva and tears, and decreased urinary bladder tone. Vagal stimulation inhibits production of the cytokine TNFα [ 106, 200].
